original_title: Sri Lanka’s Asiri group plans Port City hospital
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Asiri healthcare group, said it had entered into an agreement with Colombo Port City Economic Commission to lease land to build a hospital in the China-backed dollarized special economic zone.
Asiri Port City Hospital (Pvt) Ltd, a newly set up unit of Sri Lanka’s Softlogic group, plans to lease land withing the Port City for 99 years for the project.
The company had partnered with a corporation globally renowned for its innovative treatment options, who will provide strategic and/or operational consulting services,” a stock exchange filing said.
Asiri Port City’s medical team will be made up of local and international specialist who will be supported by international trained nursing staff, the firm said.
The hospital is aiming to draw medical tourism to the country.

The Colombo Port City is a multi-currency dollarized area which was reclaimed from the sea by CHEC Port City Holdings, a unit of China Communications and Construction Company (CCCC group). (Colombo/April17/2023)
